# numberOfRanges

**Instance Property**

Returns the number of ranges.

## Declaration

```swift
var numberOfRanges: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

A result must have at least one range, but may optionally have more (for example, to represent regular expression capture groups).

Passing [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range(at:)] the value `0` always returns the value of the the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSTextCheckingResult/range] property.  Additional ranges, if any, will have indexes from `1` to `numberOfRanges``-1`.

## Text Checking Type Range and Type

- **range**: Returns the range of the result that the receiver represents.
- **resultType**: Returns the text checking result type that the receiver represents.
- **range(at:)**: Returns the result type that the range represents.
